revision.comment: /* top */clean up, replaced: hynix → SK hynix, SK SK hynix → SK hynix
revision.text:

|brand = Linksys |model = EA6700 |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = <!-- Model Revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |wlclass = AC1750 |series = <!-- Device series --> |type = wireless router |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = Q87-EA6700 |icid = 3839A-EA6700 |us_id = <!-- US ID --> |boardid = <!-- Board Identification, Leave blank for none --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4708A0; |cpu1_cores = 2 |cpu1_type = ARM |cpu1_type_rev = Cortex-A9 |cpu1spd = 800 |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),NAND,Compact Flash --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Spansion;S34ML01G100TFI00; |flash1size = 128 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4 --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 256 |ram1chip = SK hynix;H5TQ2G63DFA-H9C; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |sw_cpu = true |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 1GbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |portbasedvlan = <!-- Support for port based vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |802.1qvlan = <!-- Support for 802.1q vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |oui = <!-- Wireless OUI -->
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = CFE;;; |stockos = Linux;;;
|exp_if_types = USB 3.0, USB 2.0 |exp_usb_num = 2 |usb_hub = <!-- USB hub compatibility -->
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 3.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = <!-- Outer barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_inner = <!-- Inner barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_len = <!-- Length of barrel --> |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = <!-- Full Serial info --> |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = <!-- flags, Leave blank for none --> |addchip = 2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks (SiGe);SE2605L;;3;,,, 5GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks (SiGe);SE5003L1;;3; |802dot11_protocols = abgn+ac
|defaulip = <!-- ???.???.???.???, default IP Address --> |defaultlogin = <!-- default Login Name, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultpass = <!-- default Password, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid = <!-- default Wireless ID, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = Wistron NeWeb |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = AdvancedTomato, DD-WRT, FreshTomato-ARM, Tomato (Shibby),
|availability = common |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 02/19/2013 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = 745883597956 |ean = 4260184662647 |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B00IGQV5XQ |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4360; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad1txchains = 3 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 3 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |rad1ac = 1300 |rad1n = 450 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 5 |rad1correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad1cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
|wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4331; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad2n = 450 |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2freq = 2.4 |rad2correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad2cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== Per the FCC photos... :"48SAB402.SGE" and "2012/12/17 G" is silkscreened ::on the (main, top) component side of the board. :The '''Cisco''' logo is silkscreened on the bottom of the board.
{{WiFiCert|WFA18397|10/11/2013}}
===Specifications=== *Device is using [[Broadcom]] BCM4708A0 (BCM4708A0KFEBG) *802.11ac Radio: [[Broadcom]] BCM4360 is using three :[[Skyworks]] SE5003L1 5GHz Power Amplifier ICs. *802.11n Radio: [[Broadcom]] BCM4331 is using three :[[Skyworks]] ''(SiGe)'' SE2605L 2.4GHz Power Amplifier [http://www.skyworksinc.com/uploads/documents/202438A.pdf ICs].
==Links of Interest== ===News=== *[http://home.cisco.com/en-us/press/releases/release_linksys_01072013 Announced in PR on '''Cisco'''] *[http://www.engadget.com/2013/01/07/linksys-reveals-a-trio-of-802-11ac-wifi-routers-with-beamforming/ ''Linksys reveals a trio of 802.11ac WiFi routers'' via '''EnGadget'''] *[http://ces.cnet.com/8301-34439_1-57562440/cisco-adds-three-more-routers-to-its-802.11ac-portfolio/ ''Cisco adds three more routers to its 802.11ac portfolio'' on '''C|NET'''] :One USB 3.0 port, One USB 2.0 port *[http://www.linksys.com/en-us/press/presskit/linkys_ea6700 Linksys press-kit for the device] :105MB TIFF of the top of the unit..
===Reviews=== *[https://experimental-engineering.co.uk/cisco-ea6700-linksys-ac1750-router/ ''Cisco EA6700 / Linksys AC1750 Router'' on '''Experimental Engineering'''] :CPU: [[Broadcom]] BCM4708A0 (ARM Cortex A9) (images PCB) :3x [[Skyworks]] SE5003L 5GHz power amplifier (23dBm) :3x [[Skyworks]] SE2605L 2.4GHz power amplifier (23dBm)
[[Category:English Documentation]]
